image.altText: A sign on top of one of the buildings at Princess Alexandra Hospital in Brisbane

props.synopsis: Health ministers are furious with a letter from the prime minister demanding they rein in spending if they want a public hospital funding deal honoured.

title.children: 'Beyond belief': PM tells states to spend less on hospitals

image.altText: A truck driving down a UK suburban street, hauling a picture of Donald Trump and Epstein together.

props.synopsis: President Donald Trump has called on his fellow Republicans in Congress to vote for the release of files related to the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title.children: Trump reverses course, says Republicans should vote to release Epstein files

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese wears black-rimmed glasses and a black suit jacket with a silver tie.

props.synopsis: As Chris Bowen lands in Belém with the clock ticking on a resolution, Anthony Albanese says the rules against co-presidency for the COP are clear.

title.children: Sharing COP presidency with Türkiye 'not an option', says Albanese

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie

props.synopsis: A judge rules in favour of Mr Lehrmann, who has been seeking a full copy of the woman's phone for several months.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann gets full forensic copy of rape complainant's phone

image.altText: Paige Greco holds her gold medal and smiles

props.synopsis: Australian Paralympian Paige Greco, who won Australia's first gold medal of the 2020 Tokyo Paralympic Games, has died aged 28.

title.children: Paralympic and world champion Paige Greco dies, aged 28

image.altText: Two people in hooded, full-body, white personal protective clothing wearing masks.

props.synopsis: After asbestos was found in a range of coloured sand, early childhood centres and schools in Australia and New Zealand are hurrying to dispose of potentially contaminated products.

title.children: Asbestos sand contamination reaches New Zealand, leading to more school closures

image.altText: A social media post with a picture of Barbie dolls in rugby gear and a Sky Sports Halo logo at the bottom.

props.synopsis: English broadcaster Sky Sports responds to widespread criticism of its new women-focused, pink-themed Sky Sports Halo TikTok channel by dumping it within days of its launch.

title.children: 'We didn't get it right': Sky dumps women's sport TikTok days after launch

image.altText: A close up of a person with face tattoos

props.synopsis: A Western Australian bikie known for his distinctive facial tattoos is fined after tattooing a Nazi swastika on his chin.

title.children: High-profile bikie fined over offensive swastika facial tattoo

image.altText: A man without a shirt and wearing black shorts with his hands behind his back is led to a paddywagon by police.

props.synopsis: More than 750 people have been charged under Operation Amarok XII, though support services say they are desperate for funding to match this police response.

title.children: Hundreds charged with DV offences in four-day blitz across NSW

image.altText: A photo of abstract artwork blue poles, which is made up of drips of red, yellow, white and black paint

props.synopsis: Art can stir strong feelings in people, both good and bad. These artworks fell in the latter, provoking great controversy in Australia, and telling us a lot about who we are as a nation.

title.children: These six artworks caused huge controversy in Australia

image.altText: Side-by-side photos of Bianca Jones and Holly Bowles, two Melbourne teens

props.synopsis: The Laos hostel accused of serving alcohol contaminated with methanol that killed six people — including two young Australian women — last November is set to reopen.

title.children: Parents of methanol victim label Vang Vieng hostel's plans 'disgusting'

image.altText: Two brown dingo pups in a rusty metal cage.

props.synopsis: Queensland is considering changes that would remove restrictions on keeping dingoes and while the government says that will not mean people can keep them as pets, experts fear it could be an unintended outcome.

title.children: Qld government denies dingoes could be kept as pets under reclassification

image.altText: Dugald Saunders in glasses and suit with flags behind him

props.synopsis: Dugald Saunders has quit as NSW Nationals leader after two and a half years in the job, in a move that has shocked his colleagues.

title.children: NSW Nats leader stands down citing need to 'focus on my family'

image.altText: A red carpet image of a blonde woman

props.synopsis: In a two-part series, the mother of television presenter Caroline Flack examines the final months of her daughter's life and what she believes to be the mishandling of the criminal case against her daughter.

title.children: Caroline Flack documentary raises questions about assault charges and British tabloid ethics

image.altText: Glass of soft drink with ice, from above

props.synopsis: You don't have to give up diet soft drinks altogether. But being mindful of how much soft drink you drink, and how often, can help you make healthier choices.

title.children: Is drinking diet soft drinks really that bad for you?

image.altText: A young First Nations man sits on concrete stairs looking serious. He wears a dark hoodie.

props.synopsis: Nye was getting into trouble and making bad choices when he was handed a lifeline that helped him turn things around.

title.children: These young men escaped restless boredom that led to chaos and crime

image.altText: Michael Hutchence sits on a chair, leaning forward, with the rest of INXS behind him.

props.synopsis: The Velvet Revolution, an Australian rock star's legacy and the youngest ever Saturday Night Live host — do you recognise these events from Novembers past?

title.children: How well do you know this week in history?

image.altText: A power station looms over trees and a curved road, emitting vapour.

props.synopsis: Amid swirling debate among conservative politicians over decarbonisation, energy bosses have warned against turning away from net zero despite cost pressures.

title.children: Energy CEOs say 'no turning back' on renewables transition

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: The ASX 200 has dropped another 0.3 per cent on top of Friday's harsh sell-off. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX slips on the back of Wall Street volatility

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: RBA may be done cutting: HSBC
Iron ore — on the other hand

image.altText: A bald man wearing a grey outfit stands in a field near some buildings.

props.synopsis: After Palestinians were expelled from three refugee camps in the Israeli occupied West Bank this year, some fear a new ceasefire in Gaza could prompt Israel to expand its operations in the area once more.

title.children: If this Palestinian returned home, he would be 'shot and killed'

image.altText: An aircraft carrier flanked by other US navy vessels with US Air Force planes flying above

props.synopsis: Following the arrival of a 100,000 tonne warship in the Caribbean, as part of a massive military build-up, President Donald Trump has hinted that the US "may be having some discussions" with Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro.

title.children: Trump hints at possibility of talks with Venezuela

image.altText: Blast furnace exterior with construction in the foreground.

props.synopsis: A worker in his 20s has died after he was hit by a steel beam while working on the upgrade of a blast furnace at the Port Kembla steelworks.

title.children: Workers 'in shock' after steelworks contractor killed by steel beam

image.altText: Tony Abbott stares into the distance.

props.synopsis: In 2011, Tony Abbott was questioned over his use of the phrase "shit happens" when discussing the death of an Australian soldier in Afghanistan. Instead of responding, he stared at the journalist, fighting the urge to thump him.

title.children: Tony Abbott reveals reason behind silence in 2011 stare-off with journalist

image.altText: A concrete building with lettering above the entrance reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory".

props.synopsis: The mother of the 15-year-old boy who died in a car crash near Parliament House last year has spoken to one of the perpetrators involved during a court sentencing.

title.children: Mother of 15yo crash victim faces man who left him 'laying on the road'

image.altText: Mid shot of a young woman on a street facing the camera

props.synopsis: Rates of child poverty in WA have doubled in a decade, but there is a severe lack of crisis accommodation, prompting experts to call on governments to do more.

title.children: Child poverty, homelessness hit new highs in mining-rich WA

image.altText: Woman in foreground and man looking towards her.

props.synopsis: The strange macho appeal of fossilised vegetation means that 30 years of annual United Nations meetings to stop the planet heating any more have been a bust.

title.children: Liberals aren't alone as net zero sceptics — but the data doesn't lie

image.altText: Close up of Ley, not speaking

props.synopsis: It was only a week ago that the moderates in the Liberal Party were flexing their muscle privately (and some publicly), threatening a divorce with the Nationals and to walk the plank if net zero was dumped. Neither threat ever materialised.

title.children: Conservatives win this one, but it could lose them the war

image.altText: Protesters are sprayed in Mexico City as they try and pull down a barrier.

props.synopsis: The demonstration was mostly peaceful but ended with some young people clashing with the police.

title.children: Thousands protest in Mexico City as gen Z protests gain momentum

image.altText: A young woman wearing a pink jacket takes a selfie photo while clutching a notepad with text on it.

props.synopsis: Family and former colleagues of a Ukrainian journalist who was captured by Russian forces and tortured are determined to do everything they can to ensure those who contributed to her death are held responsible.

title.children: 'They were trying to erase her': Family seek justice for tortured journalist

image.altText: Numerous knives with long blades, some serrated, and different coloured handles lie on a table covered in black cloth.

props.synopsis: Police have confiscated more than 15,000 bladed weapons this year amid heightened community concern over knife crime.

title.children: Victorian police seize record number of knives

image.altText: cross section of a branch showing galleries bored by the beetle

props.synopsis: Growers in this major food bowl are nervous for their future, as the state focuses its shot-hole borer efforts on outer-Perth.

title.children: Nervous fruit growers brace for invasive beetle's impact

image.altText: A dried out river bed.

props.synopsis: Cloud seeding involves spraying particles such as silver iodide and salt into clouds from aircraft to trigger rain.

title.children: Iran begins cloud seeding operations as severe drought bites

image.altText: Woman in a wheelchair interviews man on red carpet at awards show. A camera films them in the foreground.

props.synopsis: The ABC is featuring stories by and about people with disability leading up to and following December 3, the International Day of People with Disability.

title.children: Australians tell their stories for International Day of People with Disability
